channel.title: Jagex's Vertigo - Modified and fully working! by Dizzy
channel.description:
I decompiled and played around with Jagex's Vertigo game a few months ago and I just found it lying around my documents today. So I dusted it off and decided to share it with everyone.
At first the game wouldn't work since I downloaded it directly off of Jagex's site, but I fixed the problems and now it's fully working.
You can download it here: [url=http://play.speedscape.uni.cc/dizzycoders/Vertigo.rar]http://play.speedscape.uni.cc/dizzycoders/Vertigo.rar[/url]
If you don't have a program called Winrar, then you wont be able to extract the file. So for those who don't have Winrar, then you can download it [url=http://geocities.com/dizzycoders/download/winrar.html]here[/url].
To play, extract the rar file and run the file named "Play-Vertigo.bat".
~Dizzy

item.title: Jagex's Vertigo - Modified and fully working! by Dizzy
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

[quote=“ilyaostr9, post:5, topic:47902”][quote author=Dizzy link=topic=66964.msg778313#msg778313 date=1168914017]

im pretty sure that RLN Made a hack for this

I was thinking about adding cheat codes to it, but it would make it sorta boring…

If I can get some help on how to get Java programs to communicate with php and submit stuff like highscores, then I can make Vertigo more like a Online Arcade Game so you’re actually up against other peoples’ scores.
[/quote]
How bout releasing program sauce :P[/quote]

Never heard of a program sauce…

I’ve lost the source code, I’m still trying to look for it.

Read full topic
